dct_title_s: Iudaea seu Palaestina ob sacratissima redemtoris vestigia hodie dicta Terra Sancta
dct_alternative_sm: Judaea seu Palaestina ob sacratissima redemtoris vestigia hodie dicta Terra Sancta prout olim in duodecim tribus divisa separatis ab in vicem regnis Juda et Israel expressis insuper VI ultimi temporis ejusdem terrae provinciis

Iudaea seu Palaestina ob sacratissima redemtoris vestigia hodie dicta Terra Sancta prout olim in dvodecim tribvs divisa separatis ab in vicem regnis Ivda et Israel expressis insuper VI ultimi temporis ejusdem terrae provinciis
dct_description_sm: collecta ex tabulis Guil. Sansonii Christissimi Regis Geogr. a Ioh. Baptista Homanno.
Coordinates approximate and based on Greenwich meridian.
4 bar scales on map given in "Stadia", "Mille passus geometrica", "Milliaria unius horae", and "Dietae".
Shows topography, drainage, boundaries of the tribes of Israel, travel routes, places of historical interest.
Decorative cartouche shows illustrations of Moses receiving the tablets on Mount Sinai, the burning bush, and Israelites with angels.
Inset map: Populi Israelitici ex Aegypto per desertum in terram promissionis Canaan quadraginta annorum iter. stat. et profectio.

Appears in Homann's Grosser Atlas Ã¼ber die ganze Welt. Norembergae: 1716, map no. 122. Also later appeared in Homann Heirs Atlas compendiarius quinquaginta selectarum tabularum geographicorum Homanni, 1752.
